Ecosynth Aerial Data Processing Overview

Ecosynth is a suite of tools used to map and measure vegetation in three dimensions (3D) using off-the-shelf digital cameras and open-source computer vision software, from the ground or using low altitude hobbyist aircraft.

Below you will find information and tools for collecting data, turning the data into useful products for analysis, and sharing your results with others.

Stage 1: Data Acquisition with UAV

Summary: In this stage, a UAS with an attached camera flies over an area of interest, capturing images of the ground below. Click the button below to learn more about how to get started.

Prerequisites:

  • UAV with GPS Receiver
  • Camera with Continuous Capturing Functionality

Inputs:

  • Waypoints File (plotted to consider the image overlap requirements for generating point clouds)

Key Outputs:

  • UAV Telemetry File (Flight Log)
  • Image Set
  • Takeoff Elevation Relative to Mean Sea Level (MSL)


Stage 2: Point Cloud Generation

Summary: In this stage, a computer vision program constructs a point cloud from the data collected in the previous stage. While propriety software exists to do this task, Ecosynth has developed a tool called "Ecosynther" based on open source software to generate these point clouds. Currently the tool must be run remotely using an Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute instance. Learn more about how to get setup with Ecosynther in the User Guide link below.

Prerequisites:

  • Amazon EC2 Account and Access
  • Knowledge of SSH and FTP Protocols

Inputs:

  • UAV Telemetry File (Flight Log) (Currently assumes ArduPilot format)
  • Image Set

Key Outputs:

  • Bundler OUT File
  • Dense PLY File
  • Bundler Directory Tree from Ecosynther Outputs


Stage 3: Post-Processing and Analysis

Summary: In this stage, the generated point cloud is georeferenced to the UTM coordinate system, filtered for noise, and characterized for quality. The tool provided in the link below provides a simple way for users to process data through a standard pipeline. However, the pipeline is based off of the EcosynthAerial library. To learn more about what you can else you do using the EcosynthAerial pipeline, please consult the library's documentation.

Inputs:

  • Takeoff Elevation Relative to Mean Sea Level (MSL)
  • UAV Telemetry File (Flight Log) (Currently assumes ArduPilot format
  • Bundler OUT File

Key Outputs:

  • Bundler OUT File
  • Dense PLY File
  • Bundler Directory Tree from Ecosynther Outputs


Stage 4: Sharing Results with the Public

Summary: This stage offers users the ability to push collected and processed data to a database that can be publically accessed for collaborative purposes.

Inputs:

  • Metadata Information about Project
  • Waypoints File
  • Zip File of Image Set
  • Georeferenced and Noise Filtered PLY File
  • Bundler Directory Tree from Ecosynther Outputs

Database Products:

  • Project Page with Metadata and Links to Waypoints, Images, PLY File
  • Web-based Visualization Program to View Point Cloud
  • Digital Object Identifier Representing Entire Dataset


Advanced-User Tools

Noise Filtering Tool Georeferencing Tool File Parsing Tools Point Cloud Characterization and Comparsion Tool
